cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 475 miles ESE of Isla Beata, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to continue WNW across the Caribbean, slow and turn northwest near Jamaica/Cuba, then arc toward the Florida peninsula and the southeastern U.S. coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Gulf Coast (north-central section, Big Bend region)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys northward along the Florida Gulf Coast and across coastal Georgia and South Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm-force gusts (40–50 mph) possible late Wed into early Thu
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible along the Georgia coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could drop 3–6 inches, locally higher, causing urban and river flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rainbands; hazardous seas and strong rip currents affecting vessel operations
